result.execSummary:
The defendant James J. Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall obtain counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.   Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA and follow through with any recommendations.

records.addlTxt: DOC Face Sheet Intake and Investigation
In Court Notice to Defendant After Sentencing

Defendant James J. Harris in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Defendant freely and voluntarily waives right to an attorney.  Plea of guilty to count 2 possession of THC.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty of count 2 - possession of THC.  Court orders withheld sentence probation one year with conditions court costs; DNA surcharge; AODA and follow through with any recommendations; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Remaining counts are dismissed and read in.   - rt

For Appointment of An Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency and Order - Denied
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant James J. Harris in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Tlusty calls case. Court advised DE of charges, penalties, and right to counsel. DE states he is looking into retaining an attorney as he did not qualify for a SPD. DE advised of right to a timely preliminary hearing. DE waived time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court approved the waiver of time limits and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of DE in regards to his misdemeanor charges. Pretrial conference scheduled for 3-18-15 at 8:30 a.m. State requested a $5,000.00 signature bond with booking and no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription. So ordered by the Court. ap

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure. Defendant shall have no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
